title: Drawing, "Peace in a chariot, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812
medium: Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper
inscribed: Inscribed in dark gray ink, on tablet: PACE
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Peace stands within horse-drawn chariot, holding caduceus and branch. Fame flies between chariot and horses blowing her trumpet. Putto flies above, holding tablet inscribed PACE.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Peace in a chariot, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812.
1812. Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3068.
